In this situation, I feel more confident in the situation, considering that I'm trying to survive, but still my trust levels remain at 3. I wouldn't 100% trust the bully to handle the information properly. It is highly likely that they may misuse the information to make matters worse.

I agree that the reason for sharing the information is valid, despite my initial hesitation, as when people, especially children, are afraid and feel in danger, they may do anything to stay safe. This is why I give a rating of 3. Even though I do not like the idea of sharing personal details about others, when facing violence, people need to do what they can to escape danger.

I would give this statement a 3, a rating that leans more towards the middle, as I think that people often act out of self-interest. The majority of individuals would choose to comply with the bully's demands, rather than risk facing violence, even though they may disagree with the actions.

As a person, I feel that financial issues belong to a private and sensitive category of information. Therefore, I would give this statement a rating of 2, explaining I would be uncomfortable sharing this information. One would be very concerned about their financial situation and the way others react to it, therefore I would try to find alternatives to avoid sharing this information.

As financial information is personal and sensitive, I consider a 2 rating to be more appropriate, as I believe sharing such personal information is highly sensitive. Despite my belief that the information in this situation is not suitable, circumstances leave me with limited alternatives.

I would rate the statement a 2 since I am concerned about the doctor's ability to handle my finanical information with respect and responsibility. Despite having confidence in medical professionals, I would still feel cautious about the sharing of such personal details.

I would rate a 2 to this statement, as while the doctor's intention may be well-intended, it raises some concerns as it feels like an invasion of privacy as the financial issues are very personal and sensitive. Therefore, it is not necessary to divulge them, even to the doctor, as it is my personal choice, and it should remain my decision as to what information is shared with them.

I would rate this statement a 3, as it is clear that most people would probably answer the question even though they may not feel entirely comfortable. They may do so to avoid raising suspicion about the situation or to simply get out of a stressful situation without a possible conflict.

I would feel extremely uncomfortable in this situation, as it is important to me to respect the privacy of others, especially my loved ones. I understand my parent's concern, but I do not feel comfortable divulging personal financial information without my best friend's consent. Therefore, I would decline and try my best to resolve the issue or find alternative solutions without giving away any sensitive details.

This situation is complicated as there are conflicting opinions about the need to tell. In the end, I would assign this statement a rating of 2 because one should not share personal financial data. However, when it comes to family members, feelings can be quite intense. On one hand, you may not want to keep something as important and sensitive as this from them, but on the other hand you may not want to share it.

I give this statement a 2 because even though it is our parents, there have been a number of instances of them being quite nosy and going through our belongings, messages etc. Therefore, it puts some doubts in my mind about the situation as they tend to take the information they receive to the extreme as parents always worry and can go overboard for something that is not as deep as they may think it is.

I would give this statement a 2. My parents would undoubtedly be upset if I didn't tell them and would constantly bug me about the situation, demanding an explanation. Not only that, but I would then have to deal with the pressure of not telling them and the guilt of hiding it.

I would assign this statement a 3 since most people in this situation would likely tell their parent. People tend to struggle with keeping something like this from their parents and I feel most people would tell their parents because of the pressure they would feel.

I would feel conflicted in this situation as although I want to help my best friend, I would be hesitant to share personal financial information to someone I am not close with. I understand their desire to help but there is also a high likelihood that some of the information could be shared with other people, and to avoid creating any conflicts, it is best to either resolve the situation by myself or with the help of professionals.

I think there is a degree of discomfort in sharing this piece of information, so I would give this particular statement a 3. While it is always good to have supportive friends to have your back, financial problems are intimate and should not be shared with anyone unless absolutely needed.

I would give this statement a 1. It's difficult to know if my best friend will treat the information with responsibility and respect. While they may have the best intentions, they could end up sharing it with other people or making assumptions about the situation.

I would give this statement a 2 because while I understand why my best friend would be looking out for me and trying to help me in times of need, I believe I am capable of handling this situation on my own, especially since financial issues are something personal, they are not the type of problems I want to bring on to those around me. If I don't feel like telling my parents, why would I want to share this information with someone I am not comfortable opening up to?

I would give this statement a 3. Most people tend to fall for pressure and end up divulging personal information more quickly than they would have liked to. While they may not want to tell other people, the pressure to satisfy the questions of a concerned friend or loved one leads to sharing personal issues that they otherwise would have kept to themselves.

Being threatened to tell someone’s financial issues is a very uncomfortable situation to be in. It is not right to share sensitive information about someone else, especially when the other person does not want others to know about it. Therefore, I would try to find an alternative way to diffuse the situation rather than doing what the bully is demanding me do because there is no reason to betray a friend over something like this, especially when the bully is going the extreme measures to find out.
I don't really believe the situation is suitable, therefore a 5 is the best option to assign it. I don't believe giving out my intimate personal finance details is suitable, especially under duress.

I would give this statement a 5, as the bully is going to the extreme to force me to tell them about my financial issues. There is absolutely no trust level that the bully will treat the information with responsibility or respect. They are merely looking to use the information against me, or make me feel uncomfortable.

In this case, sharing the information would only be out of fear of being hurt. I don't believe there is any valid reason to share personal information. Additionally, this could worsen the situation as it will be easier to manipulate me if he knows I can be intimidated easily. So, I would rate this statement a 5.

I would give this statement a 3, as there have been many cases of people succumbing to threats out of fear for their own safety. While people may not want to share information like this, given the circumstances and fear for their well being, they would likely be forced to share this information.

I would feel comfortable sharing this kind of information as it is not something that is highly sensitive. A doctor needs to know a patient's routine, and knowing these things, such as personal values, could potentially help the doctor to make a proper diagnosis.

I would give this statement a 1, as the topic of a person's dietary habits is quite ordinary to share, as it is a routine question that a doctor may ask. It is also crucial information for the doctor as it can have a significant effect on a person's health. Therefore, there is valid reason to share this information.

I would give this statement a 2, as I believe most doctors are responsible and respect the privacy of their patients. Though there has been many times doctors have made the news for spreading sensitive information, I believe that these cases represent a small part of the medical community. Therefore, I would feel comfortable and confident that the doctor would treat the information with responsibility and respect. In the unlikely case something were to happen, there is a protocol in place to deal with any doctor that is not acting professionally.

I would give this statement a 2 as I believe it is in the best interest of the doctor to have this kind of information. Knowing that someone is vegan can be crucial to figuring out any health issues. In medicine the smallest things can have a big impact on a diagnosis. Therefore, it is valid for a person's diet to be shared, especially with a doctor.

I think there is a high probability that most people would share this information as it's not as sensitive and the doctor is a medical professional that has a good reason for knowing this information. This leads me to give this statement a 3.

It is not a sensitive bit of information and would be important for the parents to know that their child has changed their life style. It could potentially create another issue, but in my opinion, this is just common information that parents should know about their child.

I would rate this statement as a 2, as personal information like this can help friends and family understand the situation much better, as opposed to keeping that information to one's self. It may be a little more than what some parents would normally ask, but in this situation it is appropriate to share the information to the parents.

I would give a 2 as I would trust the parents to hold the information respectfully. I see no reason for not trusting them as a parental figure should be able to provide a safe haven for their child, and therefore I do not believe there would be a reason to worry that they would misuse the information.

I would give a 0 as I believe that parents should be aware of important changes to their children. While the child is free to make this choice, parents are still responsible for the child wellbeing. Therefore, it is beneficial for parents to know their child diet, whether it is for health reasons or other reasons.

I would give a 2. While I believe parents have the right to know about these changes in their children, it is not a situation where the child is necessarily obligated to disclose this information to their parents. There are a few cases where I may keep this information to myself if the child asked me not to tell their parents and it was a private request. Therefore, I believe it is dependent on the relationship between the person and their parents, which affects whether they feel comfortable sharing such information.

I believe Richard is trying to help me with what I am going through, so I feel it would be okay to tell him about my decision to be vegetarian, even though it is not something I would have thought to share on my own.

I give this a 2, as the information is suitable to be shared given that it is not highly sensitive or personal and is just about the dietary choice that I made and it is shared with a close friend who could support me with this issue.

I would give this statement a 2 because I am close to my friend and know that he is considerate about other people's problems and that he probably has good intentions, therefore I do not think I would be concerned about him spreading the information.

I would give this statement a 2 as I believe Richard was trying to help me through a difficult situation, so I think it is important to let him know what I am going through, because it is good to have someone to talk to sometimes, as I cannot carry the burden alone.

I would give this statement a 3, as the majority of people would probably feel comfortable giving this information to their best friend because they are close friends. Friends are the kinds of people that we usually feel more comfortable sharing information with, especially if they are trying to show support, so I would assume that most people would agree to reveal this information.

I would not be comfortable to share this as personal information can often be used for wrong intentions, even though my bully seems to have good intentions. I would rather try my best to de-escalate and resolve the situation with the least amount of violence.

5 - Strongly disagree
This would be completely inappropriate because the bully seems to be using the information to use it against me and for self-serving purposes. I do not think there is any reason to share this personal information with the bully.

5 - I do not agree at all. The situation seems to be hostile, and the bully is making threats to get me to share information about my personal values, so it doesn't seem like he is asking for the information for good intentions or with any respect.

Strongly disagree (5). There is no valid reason for me to share personal information about myself with the bully. The only thing it could possibly be used for, is for the bully to take advantage of the situation and use the information against me. Even in the best case scenario, I am still put into a situation where I am pressured and forced into sharing extremely personal information, which I do not think is right.
A 3, as I believe the majority of people would likely provide the information under this threat, as the threat of violence would be an extremely powerful motivator to share personal information.
